moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 c6: Slave defense, the Blacks refused the queen's gambit with 2. ... c6. The objective is to play e6 after Bf5.
moves.5. g3: I don't think this variation is the best the White camp can have. I believe that 5.Bg5 is better.
moves.5... e6: To finish the opening with Bb4, and Nbd7.
moves.6. Bg2 Nbd7 7. O-O Bb4: The Black development is finished, they just need to castle in the king side.
moves.8. Bd2 O-O 9. Ne5: It is a possible variation, but not in this position.
moves.9... Bxc3 10. Bxc3 Nxe5 11. dxe5 Ne4: If white bishop in g2 takes, the black bishop is on e4, and he attack the white castle.
moves.12. g4: 12. g4 ? give a pawn. Even if white bishop takes Knight in e4, Blacks got the center after the queens exchange. Schmoid maybe thinks that I wanted to capture the bishop in c3.
moves.12... Bxg4 13. Bf3: 13. Bf3??  Blacks got an advantage of position (Ne4) and of material (the pawn). This follow is the worst Whites could find.
moves.13... Bh3: Attack the rook in the castle. And the Blacks got supremacy in development, material and position.
moves.14... Qg5: 14. ... Qg5! The bishop can't move, and there is no solution to avoid the checkmate.
